Welcome üå≥

Hey there!

If you don‚Äôt know who I am, my name is Mike Downes and I‚Äôm very glad you are here. This site is a personal project; a little slice of the web where I can share what I‚Äôm working on, yet from a much more raw perspective. It‚Äôs a fertile place to realize the ideas in my head, to think out loud, talk to myself, and maybe you. It‚Äôs also a method of harvesting inspiration and publicly cultivating my own ideas over time. Many call this idea a digital garden. üå±

In some of my more recent creative endeavors, there has been a through-line in the advice I have received from my mentors and role models: Whatever your project may be, publish the process.

At the same time, I have finally internalized the idea that writing is thinking. I‚Äôve resisted it for so long, but a switch has finally flipped.

And lastly, I had previously been inspired by both analog and digital systems exploring ways to enhance our creativity (The Artist‚Äôs Way), mindfulness (Bullet Journal), and productivity (Second Brain). I discovered Obsidian, fell in love with Markdown, and started recognizing the benefits of exploring networked thought. Check out the graph at the bottom of this page to get a taste.

There is a lot more I‚Äôd like to share with you (and with myself) about these ideas, and plenty of others, too. I‚Äôm not only a fringe note-taking enthusiast, but a musician and web developer and human, too.

Thank you for reading this much, and if you‚Äôre curious to read more, check out the following notes:
